meanings.definition: A series of small notches or teeth along the edge of a blade or other object.
meanings.sent1: The knife's serrations helped it cut through the tough bread easily.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the serrations on the saw blade as it smoothly cut through the wood.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to chew on the serrations of the garden shears.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had serrations, cutting through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The serrations on the key made it easier to grip and turn in the lock.

meanings.definition: The act of forming or having serrations.
meanings.sent1: The creation of the serrations on the tool required precision and skill.
meanings.sent2: The serrations on the metal sheet were a result of the manufacturing process.
meanings.sent3: The artist's painting technique had a unique serrations that added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a rhythmic serrations that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The serrations on the cake icing were beautifully crafted, adding a decorative touch.
